How to make basic Flask Server.Text:
# This is how to make a basic flask server. 
## The below is a great video! 
 https://www.youtube.com/embed/mqhxxeeTbu0
### Here's how to start 
 First, you install Flask.
 If you use PIP use the following:
 ```pip install flask```
 After installing flask, you need to instance the app class. 
 Taken from [the flask documentation](https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/2.3.x/tutorial/factory/)
```
import os
from flask import Flask
def create_app(test_config=None):
# create and configure the app
app = Flask(__name__,instance_relative_config=True)
app.config.from_mapping(
SECRET_KEY='dev',
DATABASE=os.path.join(app.instance_path, 'flaskr.sqlite'),
)
if test_config is None:
# load the instance config, if it exists, when not testing
app.config.from_pyfile('config.py', silent=True)
else:
# load the testconfig if passed in
app.config.from_mapping(test_config)
# ensure the instance folder exists
try:
os.makedirs(app.instance_path)
except OSError:
pass
# a simple page that sayshello
@app.route('/hello')
def hello():
return 'Hello, World!'
return app
```
